txt.en: '[placeholder], may I ask a favour of you? Old tales among my people tell of the time before we settled in Rohan. We called ourselves the Éothéod, then, and Guthláf believed it was through this land that our ancestors came, down from the Vale of Anduin, all the way to the Riddermark, where we saw the goodness of the land and made our home.\n\n'While you are out assisting the Rangers in the Noman-lands, will you keep an eye out for any intact sign or remnant of the forebears of the Rohirrim? It would mean much to possess some such piece of our distant past.'
Collect Éothéod artifacts from the many ruins in the Noman-lands.
Éomer King can be found in the Camp of the Host, on the northern edge of North Ithilien.\n\nYou should return to Éomer King with the artifacts you found.
Éomer King believes there may be artifacts of his ancestors, the Éothéod, in the Noman-lands.
'Thank you, [placeholder]. We have precious little from the time of our forefathers. The Eorlingas will fight in our ancestors' name in the great battle to come.'
